text: Hi everyone - Is there a way I can force an email link to opened in Chrome even if the default browser is a different one? Thank you!
i gues that is up to the user to decide
As an alternative solution I like to just copy the email address to clipboard with a notification to confirm what’s happened
<@U7SR2GG9K>

Is there a way to add validation to a single form field? i.e. I want a field to only allow numerical values and be max, 10 chars. Is using the forms API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview>) only way to achieve this? seems a bit overkill to create the entire form again just to validate a single form field ...
Anyone set up a multilingual error page before?
Is my only option smart content??

I’m building a blog for a client here: <https://www.premierworkspaces.com/blog/in-the-city-0>. For the comments section I have the title: Leave A Comment. Additionally, I have comments expiring after the first week. However, the title: Leave A Comment remains
Does anyone know a way to solve this? I tried to find a HubL variable to put in an if statement - however I couldn’t find one. Any help would be much appreciated
The closest that I found was: {{ group.allow_comments }}. However that only looks at if comments are enabled (Boolean Value) - not if the comments expire
can you send me a link of the problem image? Some image is not resized because its size or dimension exceeds the limit, which could be too slow to be resized.
<@U7SR2GG9K> yes. <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/3023500/hubfs/Product%20Images/product_drivable-grass-growing.jpg?width=600&name=product_drivable-grass-growing.jpg>

I would check the published date against the current date. If the difference is over 7 days, then use default/fallback text. use the `between_times` filter: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters#between-times>
Once you set the featured image for a page, how long does it usually take for facebook/linkedin to start pulling that image for shared links?
i've noticed its usually no more than 15-30 mins for the caching to change on the site and have the new image in there
You can always use the facebook sharing debugging to check as well: <https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/sharing/>
if you have multiple urls, there is Batch Invalidator tab you can use as well.
Thanks! Maybe i just need to wait a bit more

Hi <@U3T21PDBK>, the issue is due to an unsupported image color encoding. We are woking on a new image resizing service, it is in beta now. do you want me to ungate the portal to use the latest image service ?   <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/3023500/hubfs/Product%20Images/product_drivable-grass-growing.jpg?width=600&name=product_drivable-grass-growing.jpg>
yes please
done
thank you!
hey patrick it was
thank you for replying
hey guys, is anyone else having issues with the template marketplace
Seems SSL provisioning is taking a really long time these days.. often a few hours where a business gets a non-secure message. Has something changed recently?
What issue are you having? Somtimes I have to visit the site via my portal first. You'll see a marketplace URL with portal number in it
Anyone ever get the following in email:
i've never seen it and HubSpot status looks operational
yikes
any reports after attempt?
look like they didn't verify the user in the backend
as of 1/30/19 HubSpots now requiring users be verified in order to send from them.
what does that mean exactly?>
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/email/verify-the-email-address-used-to-send-marketing-emails>
Basically if you create an account for someone in HS and they never go through the signup process, they just sit in a "pending verification" status
so you cant send email through HubSpot using that address as a from
good to know
i can see this happening

Yea, i want to say the cutoff says it was Jan 30th, but it was still allowed to happen as of Feb 28th. So I think what needs to happen is a better error message saying something like:
`Error: This email failed to send because the FROM email address is not verified... Maybe get a coffee and wait... or just go kick that individual and tell them to finish their setup.`
